topic.name: Digital Art & Illustration
topic.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Digital Art & Illustration in Fine Arts

objectives.objective_text: Identify a flipbook.
Identify the frame rate (speed).
Identify what the character is holding.
Identify black outlines.
Identify the 'Undo' button as a way to fix mistakes.
Identify the paint bucket tool.
Recall that cartoons are many pictures fast.
Observe stop-motion video.
Explain simple rigging (bones).
Recall that we color carefully.
Recall that pixels are little squares.
Make a ball move across the screen.
Summarize 'Frame by Frame' animation.
Explain 'Onion Skinning' (seeing the ghost of previous frame).
Add simple shadows.
Draw a hero or monster.
Give the character a name and a job.
Color the character's clothes.
Summarize a 'Turnaround' (front view, side view).
Explain how shape language shows personality (round=nice, sharp=mean).
Explain the 'Thumbnails' phase of ideation.
Defend the 'Form follows Function' rule in biological design.
Trace over a pencil line.
Color inside the lines.
Summarize the 'Flatting' process (solid colors).
Explain line weight (thick and thin).
Use a separate layer for color.
Explain color holding (colored lines).
Defend the stylistic choice of inking style.
Use a mouse or finger to draw a line on a screen.
Save a drawing with a name.
Locate the eraser tool.
Summarize the difference between drawing on paper vs. a screen.
Use a stylus to control cursor movement.
Explain the concept of 'Layers' (stacking acetate).
Explain resolution (DPI) before starting a canvas.
Defend the ergonomic importance of posture and grip.
Change the size of the brush.
Pick a color from the rainbow wheel.
Summarize Opacity (see-through) vs. Flow.
Explain 'Hardness' (fuzzy edge vs. sharp edge).
Use the Eyedropper to steal a color.
Blend two colors using a smudge tool.
Explain the 'Alpha Lock' function.
Defend the use of non-destructive editing layers.
Drag and drop shapes (circle, square) to make a picture.
Fill a shape with color.
Resize a shape to make it big or small.
Group shapes together.
Summarize why vectors stay smooth when big (math).
Use the Pen Tool to make straight lines.
Explain the difference between a Stroke (outline) and Fill.
Align objects to the center.
Explain the advantage of Vector for logos.
Defend the scalability of vector graphics for billboards.
Analyze Keyframes vs. Tweens.
Interpret the 12 Principles of Animation (Squash and Stretch).
Connect timing to weight.
Compare a sketch with a finished drawing.
Analyze the silhouette for readability.
Interpret the function of costume design.
Connect anatomy rules to creature design.
Analyze Cel Shading vs. Soft Shading.
Interpret the light source direction.
Connect line confidence to professional look.
Organize files into folders.
Analyze the effect of pressure sensitivity on line weight.
Interpret the workspace layout (palettes, tools).
Connect keyboard shortcuts to workflow speed.
Analyze Blending Modes (Multiply, Screen, Overlay).
Interpret the use of Clipping Masks.
Connect texture overlays to visual interest.
Analyze Bezier curves and handles.
Interpret Boolean operations (Unite, Subtract, Intersect).
Connect nodes to close a path.
Evaluate the smoothness of an easing curve.
Defend the physics of the movement.
Create a simple loop (GIF).
Evaluate the environmental storytelling in a design.
Evaluate the harmony of the color palette.
Evaluate hardware calibration (color accuracy, parallax).
Evaluate lighting and material rendering (subsurface scattering).
Evaluate the 'economy of points' (clean paths).
Construct a complex motion graphic sequence.
Synthesize character acting with lip sync.
Create a simple backstory.
Construct a professional character sheet (poses, expressions, assets).
Synthesize cultural research with fantasy elements.
Construct a fully rendered illustration.
Synthesize ambient occlusion and rim lighting.
Construct a professional digital workspace customized for efficiency.
Synthesize file management best practices (backups, naming conventions).
Construct a digital painting using custom brushes.
Synthesize matte painting techniques for photorealism.
Construct complex vector artwork using gradients and meshes.
Synthesize typography with vector illustration.
